Award.AwardTitle: S&AS: COLLAB: Organization of the 2018 Smart and Autonomous Systems (S&AS) PI Meeting

Directorate.LongName: Direct For Computer & Info Scie & Enginr

Award.AbstractNarration:
The objective of this award is to organize the inaugural Principal Investigators (PI) meeting for the Smart and Autonomous Systems (S&AS) program. As this is a new program, the PI meeting will set the intellectual tone for and create a community around this new NSF program, centered at intelligent physical systems that are cognizant, taskable, reflective, ethical, and knowledge-rich. The PI meeting will bring together researchers, companies, and program officers who are actively engaged in S&AS to provide cross-project coordination in terms of common intellectual challenges, methods for education and training, best practices in terms of transition of results, and a lasting repository illustrating the research ideas explored and milestones achieved by the S&AS projects. The PI meeting will take place during April 5-6, 2018, in Washington DC, and the format will include short presentations by all the attending PIs, poster sessions, keynote speeches, and panel discussions. Invitations to the meeting will include all PIs with active S&AS grants, program managers involved with related programs, as well as industry representatives and members of the press.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The inaugural Smart and Autonomous Systems (S&AS) PI Meeting was held on April 5–6, 2018 at the Hilton Alexandria Old Town in Alexandria, Virginia. This report summarizes how the PI meeting was structured as well as reports on the results from the post-meeting survey, and comments on what worked well in anticipation of future S&AS PI Meetings.

As the Smart and Autonomous Systems Program is a relatively new NSF program, the inaugural PI meeting was carefully designed to help define and set the intellectual tone for the program. At the same time, the program was crafted in such a way that it would help facilitate the creation of a strong community, focusing on intelligent physical systems that are cognizant, taskable, reflective, ethical, and knowledge-rich.

Given the two over-arching ambitions (intellectual themes and community creation) the PI meeting brought together researchers, companies, and program officers who are actively engaged in S&AS with the ambition to provide cross-project coordination in terms of common intellectual challenges, methods for education and training, and best practices in terms of transition of results. 

In order to ensure that the outcomes from the PI meeting resulted in a lasting repository illustrating the research ideas explored and milestones achieved by the S&AS projects, a dedicated website was set up to this effect, available at http://robotics.gatech.edu/SASPI. Additionally, all PIs in the program participated in Lightning Presentations,  and their presentations are available to the public on the website at http://robotics.gatech.edu/SASPI/presentations.

 

 


Last Modified: 02/20/2019
Modified by: Magnus B Egerstedt
